elements.title: King Manor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a radio host got a free apartment in New York City's King Manor (pictured) and lived there for more than three decades?

elements.title: Kihwan Sim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kihwan Sim, a bass-baritone performer at the Oper Frankfurt, learned to play the tuba during his two years of military service?

elements.title: A Field Guide to Otherkin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the publication of A Field Guide to Otherkin sparked scholarly interest in people who consider themselves animals or mythological creatures?

elements.title: Bill Madden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Cross recipient Bill Madden died as result of malnutrition and ill-treatment by his Chinese captors while a prisoner of war?

elements.title: Nonô (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nonô's discography includes songs from Majestic and Punctual?

elements.title: Louise Julien (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Louise Julien may have been an inspiration for the character of Cosette in Les Misérables?

elements.title: Nakba denial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nakba denial is a form of historical negationism pertaining to the 1948 Palestinian expulsion and flight?

elements.title: chain-melted state (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that being in the chain-melted state makes some metals behave as a liquid and solid at the same time?
